SALESFORCE HELP
DOCS
NONPROFIT CLOUD
Ad Hoc Benefit Disbursement Tracking

You can track ad hoc disbursements for recipients who didn't enroll for a benefit before availing it. For example, people who walk in to a mental health awareness talk. You can also track disbursements for recipients of benefits without a schedule or session. For example, people from a flood-affected area who receive emergency help kits as part of a one-time kit distribution benefit.

Recipients are of one of these types:

Program Enrollment
Recipients who are participants in at least one program.
Walk-in
Recipients who have an account or contact record in Salesforce, but aren't added in any program as participants.
Anonymous
Recipients who don't have an account or contact record in Salesforce.

Select the recipient type based on your use case. For example, select Walk-in to track disbursement for someone with a Salesforce account who walks in to a paper bag making workshop. Select Anonymous to track disbursements for people who received the emergency help kits during a flood, considering their accounts or contacts aren't available in Salesforce.

When you select a walk-in recipient, program enrollment, benefit assignment, and benefit disbursement records are automatically created. Also, the recipient type value on the benefit disbursement record is updated to Walk-in. For an anonymous and program enrollment recipient, a benefit disbursement record is created per recipient.

If your organization supports anonymous recipients, you must create a program enrollment record for an anonymous recipient type. When you select an anonymous recipient, benefit assignment and benefit disbursement records are automatically created, and the program enrollment record that you created is associated with the benefit assignment record.

NOTE You can avoid data skew while managing a high volume of anonymous participants by creating multiple program enrollment records of anonymous recipient type. When an anonymous type of program enrollment record reaches ~10 K benefit disbursements, create another program enrollment of anonymous type and set the earlier program enrollment as inactive.
Create Program Enrollment for Anonymous Benefit Recipients
Before you can track benefit disbursements for anonymous recipients, create at least one program enrollment record.
Create Ad Hoc Benefit Disbursements
Use the ad hoc bulk disbursements to track benefit disbursements for people who didn't enroll but received a benefit or for benefits without a schedule or session.
